jsQuestions.title: Write A Function
jsQuestions.question: Write a function called 'test' which takes a and b as arguments.  The function should return a

jsQuestions.title: Functions that Add
jsQuestions.question: Write a function called 'add' that takes two arguments, num1 and num2.  Return the product of the two arguments.

jsQuestions.title: Length of Arrays
jsQuestions.question: Code a function called 'arrayLength' that takes an 'array' as an argument.  The function should return the length of the array.

jsQuestions.title: Last Index of Array
jsQuestions.question: Write a function called `findLast` which takes an array as an argument. This function should return the last item in the array.

jsQuestions.title: Count Characters in a String
jsQuestions.question: Given a string input and a character, the function 'countCharacter' returns the number of occurrences of a given character in the given string.

htmlQuestions.title: Titles with h1
htmlQuestions.question: Using an h1 element write 'My first HTML title'

htmlQuestions.title: Link To JQuery
htmlQuestions.question: Use script tags to link to the jQuery CDN.  Here is the address for the jQuery CDN: 'jquery-3.3.1.min.js'... hint! hint! use the src attribute to link the libary

htmlQuestions.title: Add an HTML Link
htmlQuestions.question: Using an `a` element add a link to 'https://think-programming-client.herokuapp.com'. make the links text say 'Think Programming' and use the href attribute inside of the a tags.

htmlQuestions.title: Adding a class to an HTML element
htmlQuestions.question: Make an h2 element with a class of 'think-programming-title' and the text 'Think Programming'

htmlQuestions.title: Unordered Lists
htmlQuestions.question: Make an Unordered List with two list items.  There should be a class of `my-list` on the UL.  the first li element should `learn to program` as its text and the second li should have the text, `become a developer`.  the first li should have a key attribute equal to 1 and the second with a key attribute equal to 2.

cssQuestions.title: Comments in CSS
cssQuestions.question: Use the correct CSS syntax to write a short comment on what this does: `p { color: red }`

cssQuestions.title: Background Color
cssQuestions.question: Which property is used to change the background color? (Options: color, background, background-color, bgcolor)

cssQuestions.title: Text Size
cssQuestions.question: Which CSS property controls the text size? (Options: text-style, font-style, font-size, text-size)

cssQuestions.title: Element
cssQuestions.question:
Use the correct CSS syntax to make all the

elements bold

cssQuestions.title: Position Property
cssQuestions.question: What is the default value of the position property? (Options: relative, absolute, static, fixed)

dsaQuestions.title: Constant Time
dsaQuestions.question: What is the constant time complexity in terms of Big-O notation?

dsaQuestions.title: Bubble Sort
dsaQuestions.question: What is the average time complexity of Bubble sort? (Options: O(1), O(n), O(n^2), O(log n))

dsaQuestions.title: Quick Sort
dsaQuestions.question: What is the average time complexity of Quick sort? (Options: O(1), O(n), O(n^2), O(n log(n))

dsaQuestions.title: Determine the Big O
dsaQuestions.question: You are in a room with 15 puppies to find a playmate for your puppy who is of the same breed. You start with the first puppy to check if he is a samoyed. He was not, so you move on to the next puppy, and the next, and the next until you find a samoyed or until there is no more puppies to check.

dsaQuestions.title: Big O
dsaQuestions.question: Big O measures algorithm speed in terms of... (Options: Space, Memory, Seconds, Growth of the number of operations)
